string.text: This is an ITEM test string
This is another ITEM test string

Powerful electronic lockpick. Oddly, it doesn't seem to be an all-purpose burglars' tool. Rather, to have been created with a specific electronic lock in mind, and so can't be used to override anything else
Plastic document file. But you'd need doctorates in Engineering and Biology to understand a word of what it says...
A thick pile of scientific documents. Contains unusual terminology, complex formulas, and bizarre diagrams
Documents from Lab X-18, part I
Documents from Lab X-18, part II
Documents from Lab X-18, part III
Documents from Lab X-18, part IV
Documents from Lab X-18, part V
Tattered manuscript in a leather binding. Written in Strelok's hand. Judging by the headings alone, it might explain why he was so passionate to uncover the Zone's secrets...
Documents from the secret stash in Pripyat
A heavy wooden crate emblazoned with the word 'Explosives' in several Slavic languages
Prototype helmet developed by Scientists to protect the wearer from mild Psi-emissions. It has yet to be calibrated properly for use throughout the Zone...

A helmet designed to protect the wearer from Psi-emissions. This prototype has been calibrated using recent measurements of local psionic activity, which makes it about as good as you're going to get. For now...

Before you can make use of a manual teleportation device, you'll need a 'Moonlight' artefact. Drop the device on the ground in front of you, and a transition point will be created. It's only good for one use, so use it judicially.\n It's calibrated to get you from the Garbage to the Swamp, but make sure no one sees you use it, unless you want to be mugged by Bandits next time they spot you. You know how rumours spread around here...
Sakharov says he can make me a teleportation device using info from the documents in the Lab. In order to build it, though, he'll also need a 'Battery' artefact. Oh, and about 10,000 rubles...

Greetings, Strelok, my old friend. It's Ghost. I've altered the entry sequence to our hideout, so don't be alarmed. The new entrance will still be here in the Underground, so you'll have no trouble finding it. You're the smartest guy I know! \nP.S. The teleportation device is still safe and secure in the hideout
